title: Fur-well: Macy's says it will stop selling real fur by 2021
text:
CLOSE

Macy's will stop selling fur by early 2021, the department store retailer announced Monday.

Macy's will still sell clothes that feature faux fur, but said its customers are moving away from real fur. The company also admitted its decision has also been influenced by animal rights advocates as well.

The decision applies to its namesake stores, Bloomingdales' and their discount outlets. The company's house brands are already fur-free and by the end of fiscal 2020 (which ends February 2021) it won't sell any vendor products with fur.

“Over the past two years, we have been closely following consumer and brand trends, listening to our customers and researching alternatives to fur," said CEO said Jeff Gennette. "We are proud to partner with the Humane Society of the United States in our commitment to ending the sale of fur."
